node.title: 'Stop making things up': Premier shuts down claim WA will open early for Ashes Test
node.description: The WA Premier rejects a claim by Federal Health Minister Greg Hunt that the state might drop its borders early for the Perth Ashes Test, telling the Commonwealth government to "stop making things up".
node.content:
["The WA Premier\u00a0has dismissed a claim by Federal Health Minister Greg Hunt that Western Australia might open its borders earlier than expected to coincide with the Perth Ashes Test.", "Mr Hunt told the ABC's\u00a0Insiders program on Sunday that WA's border re-opening could coincide with the\u00a0Ashes Test in Perth, which is scheduled to start on\u00a0January 14.", "The WA Government's transition plan stated WA would likely drop its hard border in late January or early February, with a date to be set once 80 per cent of the population aged over 12 was fully vaccinated.\u00a0", "\"We'd like to see Western Australia open as soon as possible,\" Mr Hunt said.\u00a0", "\"It's obviously a matter for them. It is subject to their assessments.", "\"But we are hearing that they are considering bringing that forward to at least... well, coincidently, to time with the cricket.\"", "", "
Federal Health Minister Greg Hunt said he had heard WA was planning to re-open in time for the Perth Ashes Test.(ABC News: Adam Kennedy)
", "But WA Premier Mark McGowan said that was not true.", "\"I've never met Greg Hunt, I've never spoken to Greg Hunt, I wouldn't know him if I met him,\" Mr McGowan said on Monday.", "\"He has got a very vivid imagination.\u00a0He has not spoken to the [WA] Health Minister.", "Mr McGowan was yet to confirm reports the Ashes match would allow players to enter and have a five-day quarantine period, which has outraged West Australians locked out of WA and separated from loved ones.", "\"No decision has been made,\" Mr McGowan said.", "\"There is a conversation between Police and Health with Cricket Australia, and cricket would have to abide by the health requirements put in place.\u00a0", "\"We have put in place very strong measures over the last two years for cricket and sporting teams and cricket needs to abide by it.\"", "Mr McGowan said WA was expected to reach 83 per cent first dose coverage for all people aged 12 and over on Monday, with 70 per cent expected to be double-dosed by the end of the day.\u00a0"]
